SENT.plain: X-linked lissencephaly with ambiguous genitalia syndrome (XLAG) (OMIM #3000215) is a rare, severe malformation of the brain cortex with abnormal neuronal migration caused by mutations of the ARX gene

All the reported patients with lissencephaly are males who presented with a posterior-to-anterior gradient, moderately increased thickness of the brain cortex, agenesis of corpus callosum, micropenis, and cryptorchidism
We describe the neurosonographic findings associated with the XLAG syndrome
To our knowledge, the association between XLAG and lenticulostriate vasculopathy has not been reported before
